alert.note: Alert for Lower Bucks; Upper Bucks (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 14 at 3:31PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Hunterdon, northwestern Mercer, southwestern Somerset and central Bucks Counties through 400 PM EDT... At 331 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over New Hope, or 15 miles northwest of Trenton, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ewing, Princeton, Byram, Pennington, New Hope, Hopewell, Stockton, Washington Crossing, Skillman, Lawrenceville, Lumberville, Lambertville and Princeton North. This includes Interstate 295 in New Jersey between mile markers 71 and 74. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
